definition: to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)

sentences.english: With Victor’s guard down, Jack knocks him to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 由於維克多的戒心鬆懈，傑克將他擊倒在地。

sentences.english: What he found was a country suspicious of the new king.
sentences.chinese: 他發現新國家對他這個新國王充滿了戒心。

sentences.english: Ingratiation is that you show you unction which would make other people feel uncomfortable and have defensive feeling.
sentences.chinese: 逢迎是虛情假意，那會造成別人的戒心和不舒服。

sentences.english: Technological innovations always keep us in awe, and precautions are seriouly considered.
sentences.chinese: 我們對技術變革始終心存敬畏，甚至留有戒心。

sentences.english: If he fears the intellectual, he despises the boor.
sentences.chinese: 他對知識分子有戒心，但是更瞧不起鄉下人。

sentences.english: Every year Google perpetrates its own April fools pranks on unsuspecting web users.
sentences.chinese: 都會對沒有戒心的網絡用戶搞搞愚人節惡作劇。

sentences.english: Men are not suspicious when a lovely young girl starts chatting to them.
sentences.chinese: 當一個可愛的年輕女子上前搭訕時，男人不會有戒心。

sentences.english: But Kingston's sincerity is apparent and disarming.
sentences.chinese: 但是湯婷婷的真誠顯而易見，消除了我戒心。

definition: to be afraid of the consequences/restraining fear
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
